detail.reasoning: The given text claims that the gravitational forces of black holes are greater than those of neutron stars. The evidences provided support this claim. Evidence 1 and 3 describe black holes as having extremely high gravitational forces, so much so that not even light can escape them. Evidence 6 describes neutron stars as having immense density and mass, but it does not claim that their gravitational forces exceed those of black holes. Evidence 8 further supports the idea that black holes have very strong gravitational forces. There is no evidence provided that contradicts the claim that black holes have greater gravitational forces than neutron stars.
